availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William D. Lowe (Monticello, Ky, laborer and first lieut (U.S.A.))

body.p: Monticello, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Amy Lowe. Laborer in Bledsoe County, Tennessee, in 1850. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as captain and first lieutenant from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Bledsoe County, Eastern District, p. 387A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 360.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 935.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application 329218, Certificate 384149.
KYR-0002-222-0139.
